JobFullDesc: Mixed Reality Overview In Mixed Reality, people—not devices—are at the center of everything we do. Our tech moves beyond screens and pixels, creating a new reality aimed at bringing us closer together—whether that’s scientists “meeting” on the surface of a virtual Mars or some yet undreamt-of possibility. To get there, we’re incorporating groundbreaking technologies, from the revolutionary Holographic Processing Unit to computer vision, machine learning, human-computer interaction, and more.   We’re a growing team of talented engineers, program managers and artists putting technology on a human path across all Windows devices, including Microsoft HoloLens, the Internet of Things, phones, tablets, desktops, and Xbox. Our team has people from a wide variety of backgrounds, identities, previous work histories, life experiences, and we are eager to maintain and grow that diversity. Our varied backgrounds and unique experiences enable us to be better at building the best solutions for our customers and make for dynamic and joyful collaborations with colleagues!   If you are passionate about groundbreaking Mixed Reality technology and want to work on a team dedicated to a culture of inclusion, growth mindset and collaboration, we need you!   Team Overview: As the team responsible for software Compliance, Release, Deployment & Device Update, Servicing, Flighting, and Measuring Quality, we enable engineers to create and ship high quality MR Devices and software to allow our external customers and partners to deliver value and innovation to their customers in a timely manner.ResponsibilitiesDrive in market VR engagement with external customers and partners, including social media follow-throughWork with Mixed Reality Content & Learning team to ensure public-facing documentation is kept up to dateManage in market VR relationship with internal partners such as CSS and developer communityProvide a wide range of test coverage for in market VR hardware, including making recommendations to vendor test team for expanded coverageDrive servicing updates for VR customers from the point of feedback to release in a quality updateCoordinate with Windows Insider community, both internal to Microsoft and external, to selfhost the top areas of interest, including helping to triage new feedback bugs that come from this effortQualifications2+ years of experience in program management within a product development and engineering teamOverwhelming ability to synthesize new information to develop sound operational recommendations.
